solution_line_template: The ${remaining_money_after_spending} is 1 - {fraction_spent_remainder} = {fraction_of_money_left_after_spending} of the money left.

Since {fraction_of_money_left_after_spending} is equal to ${remaining_money_after_spending}, then {fraction_spent_remainder} is equal to ${remaining_money_after_spending}/{fraction_of_money_left_after_spending.numerator} = ${value_of_one_quarter}.

So Lucy had ${value_of_one_quarter} x {fraction_of_money_left_after_spending.denominator} = $<<{value_of_one_quarter}*{fraction_of_money_left_after_spending.denominator}={money_left_after_loss}>>{money_left_after_loss} left after losing 1/3 of her money.
Hence, ${money_left_after_loss} is 1 - {fraction_lost_initial} = {fraction_of_initial_money_remaining} of the money that Lucy had at the beginning.

Since {fraction_of_initial_money_remaining} is equal to ${money_left_after_loss}, then {fraction_lost_initial} is equal to ${money_left_after_loss}/{fraction_of_initial_money_remaining.numerator} = ${value_of_one_third}.

Therefore, Lucy had ${value_of_one_third} x {fraction_of_initial_money_remaining.denominator} = $<<{value_of_one_third}*{fraction_of_initial_money_remaining.denominator}={initial_money}>>{initial_money} at the beginning.
